name: Oscars and Oscar Nominations Quiz / Test | Oscars - General Trivia | 10 Questions

questions.text: This Oscar winning movie, made in 1965, starred Tony Curtis and Natalie Wood.  "The ____ Race".
questions.explanation:
Great & great.

	"The Great Race" won the Oscar for Best Sound Effects but was nominated for Best Photography, Best Sound Effects, Best Editing and Best Song.

questions.text: Which two Oscars did the 1977 movie, "Close Encounters of the Third Kind", directed by Steven Spielberg, win?
questions.correct: Best Photography and Best Sound Effects Editing
options: Best Photography and Best Art Direction
Best Supporting Actress and Best Photography
Best Sound Effects and Best Supporting Actress
questions.explanation:
Best Photography and Best Sound Effects Editing.

	"Close Encounters of the Third Kind" was nominated for seven Academy Awards and shared the award for Best Sound Effects Editing with "Star Wars".

questions.text: The 1974 movie, "Murder on the Orient Express", was nominated for five Academy Awards.  Which actress attained the only Oscar for this movie in the category of Best Supporting Actress?
questions.explanation:
Ingrid Bergman.

	Ingrid Bergman has three Academy Awards to her name.  She won in the category of Best Supporting Actress for "Murder on the Orient Express" for her portrayal of a Swedish missionary.

questions.text: In 1980, who starred as "Private Benjamin", earning a Best Actress Nomination for her role?
questions.explanation:
Goldie Hawn & Hawn.

	"Private Benjamin" received three Oscar nominations, Best Actress, Best Supporting Actress and Best Screenplay.

questions.text: "Titanic" equalled which all time great movie (made in 1959) by winning eleven Oscars in 1997?
questions.explanation:
Ben-Hur & Ben Hur & BenHur.

	"Ben Hur" won Oscars for Best Effects, Best Actor, Best Costume Design, Best Supporting Actor, Best Art Direction, Best Sound, Best Music, Best Editing, Best Director, Best Cinematography and Best Picture.

questions.text: Which Oscar category was "Saturday Night Fever", made in 1977, nominated in?
questions.explanation:
Best Actor.

	"Saturday Night Fever", starring John Travolta, received just the one Oscar nomination in the category of Best Actor.

questions.text: Made in 1970 "M.A.S.H." won the Oscar for Best Screenplay.  What do the letters in the title, "M.A.S.H.", stand for?
questions.explanation:
Mobile Army Surgical Hospital.

	The movie, "M.A.S.H.", spawned the television show of the same name which ran longer than the actual Korean War it was set in!

questions.text: "You'll Believe a Man Can Fly" was the advertising blurb for which Best Visual Effects Oscar winning film of 1978 which co-starred Marlon Brando and Gene Hackman?
questions.explanation:
Superman.

	Margot Kidder was the female lead alongside Christopher Reeve, in his first major movie role, as "The Man of Steel"!

questions.text: Marlon Brando was nominated for the Best Actor Oscar for "A Streetcar Named Desire" (1951).  Whom did he lose the Best Actor Oscar to?
questions.explanation:
Humphrey Bogart.

	Humphrey Bogart won the Best Actor Oscar for "The African Queen", starring alongside Katherine Hepburn.

questions.text: "A Beautiful Mind" won how many Oscars at the Academy Awards in 2002?
questions.explanation:
4.

	Russell Crowe, the New Zealand born Australian actor, missed out on the Best Actor Oscar (Denzel Washington won).  Director Ron Howard won for Best Director, the movie won the Best Picture Oscar, Best Supporting Actress Oscar and Best Adapted Screenplay Oscar.
